DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of the second surgical procedure performed for recurrent or progressive disease. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement for cancer following the return of signs and symptoms of after a period of improvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA). Reviewed and approved for Release by TCGA team on 1/8/2010
